intro: Paronychia capitata var. obtusata, commonly known as the bluntleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, typically on slender stalks. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a bluish-green color and a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
